questions.question: I have ......................... time to talk to you now.
questions.description: No is used with a noun to mean not any.

questions.question: She has answered ................................ of the questions.
questions.description: We use none of before a pronoun or a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: .............................. matter what you say, I won't believe you.
She is ............................. fool.
questions.description: This is a more emphatic way of saying 'She is not a fool.'

questions.question: ................................. of the students participated in the program.
questions.description: We use none of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: I waited for hours, but .............................. came.
questions.description: No one means the same as nobody.

questions.question: ................................. of them could solve the puzzle.
questions.description: We use none of before a pronoun.

questions.question: .............................. surprisingly, he failed the test.
questions.description: We use not to make a word, clause or expression negative.

questions.question: I can come tomorrow, but ................................ on Monday.
questions.description: We use not to make a word, clause or expression negative.

questions.question: ................................ of the onlookers came forward to help him.
questions.description: We use none of before a pronoun or a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: ............................... doctors went on strike.
questions.description: No is used with a noun to mean not any.
